revised_title: The Passage of Blood Corpuscles through Vessel Walls
tldr: The author discusses the process of blood corpuscles passing through the walls of blood vessels. They propose that the vessel walls and blood corpuscles adhere to each other and then undergo a contractile state, allowing the corpuscles to pass through without leaving a trace of the aperture. The author compares this phenomenon to the behavior of soap films and other colloidal films, which exhibit similar properties of progressive cohesive attraction.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
